Class ObstructionControllerFAULT

  • java.lang.Object
    • controllers.ObstructionControllerFAULT
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    LightSensorListener, UltrasonicSensorListener

    public class ObstructionControllerFAULT
extends java.lang.Object
implements LightSensorListener, UltrasonicSensorListener
    This class will evade objects

    01-04-2014

    1.2

    Pim van Hespen

    • Method Detail

      • lightSensorChanged

        public void lightSensorChanged(Position position,
                      UpdatingSensor updatingsensor,
                      float oldValue,
                      float newValue)
        If the measured value from the light sensor changes this method is called. When called this method checks the position of the sensor who called this method, and sets the attribute corresponding to the position.
        Specified by:
        lightSensorChanged in interface LightSensorListener
        Parameters:
        position - the position of the sensor used
        updatingsensor - the sensor that is been updated
        oldValue - the value before the change
        newValue - the value after the change
        See Also:
        sensors.LightSensorListener#lightSensorChanged(sensors.SensorPosition, sensors.UpdatingSensor, float, float)

      • ultraSonicChanged

        public void ultraSonicChanged(UpdatingSensor us,
                     float oldValue,
                     float newValue)
        If the measured value from the ultrasonic sensor changes this method is called. When called this method checks of the new value is smaller than the safe value, if that's true the robot plays sounds, displays a message and starts a evasive maneuver. When the new value is bigger than the save distance any messages on the display disappear.
        Specified by:
        ultraSonicChanged in interface UltrasonicSensorListener
        Parameters:
        us - The sensor from which the value is changed
        oldValue - The old value from the sensor
        newValue - The new value from the sensor
        See Also:
        UltrasonicSensorListener.ultraSonicChanged(sensors.UpdatingSensor, float, float)
